intro: Thyrsacanthus callistachyus var. amplus, commonly known as the broad-leafed burrweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces spiny, ball-like fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are typically broad and lobed, with a rough texture. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments.
